title: Unsupervised Masks - CV 0.60
description: Unsupervised Masks - CV 0.60In this kernel, we create segmentation masks without using the annotators' training masks! Instead we build a classifier to classify images into Fish, Flower, Gravel, and Sugar. By looking at hundreds of images of Fish, the CNN learns to recognize Fish in the images. Even though we don't tell the network what specifically is a Fish within the image, the CNN determines where and what Fish are by understanding the similarity between many images containing Fish. This feels like magic! There is a great blog why this works here. Some of this notebook's code was taken from the blogger's GitHub here
